questions.question: Which ancient ruin, found in the jungles of modern-day Mexico, was a major city during the Maya civilization and is known for its Temple of the Inscriptions?
questions.context: The Temple of the Inscriptions houses one of the longest Maya inscriptions and is the burial site of the Mayan ruler Pakal.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Spain is renowned for its well-preserved Roman aqueduct, featuring 167 arches, that brought water to the city from the nearby mountains?
questions.context: The aqueduct was constructed around the 1st century AD and remains a majestic example of Roman engineering.

questions.question: Which architectural marvel, located in the UAE, was opened in 2010 and holds the record for the tallest building on Earth?
questions.context: Standing at 829.8 meters, this skyscraper features a staggering 163 floors and attracts millions of visitors each year.

questions.question: Which dark tourism site in Ukraine, the scene of a 1986 nuclear disaster, offers insight into the catastrophic effects of radiation and human error?
questions.context: Pripyat, once home to 49,000 people, was evacuated in the aftermath of the explosion and remains a ghost town frozen in time.
